He launched his career as a creative artist in 2004 with his participation in a multi-artist exhibition entitled 'B-port -Yohaku no chi' (literally, "the Land on the Margins of B-port"), which was held in gallery space B at Osaka Seikei University by the Faculty of Art and Design.

sen.j: 同年は、株式会社川島織物セルコンの浴衣ブランド「METEYUNDE」のデザイナーを担当するなど活動の幅を広げており、吉田デザインの浴衣「Float Flower」は、女優・宮崎あおいが着用するなど注目を浴びた（ゆかた夏きもの 着こなしBOOK 2006年度版／インデックス社-参照）。
sen.e: The same year, the range of his creation expanded to the design of yukata (Japanese summer kimono) for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd.'s yukata brand "METEYUNDE": his design attracted attention as the actress Aoi MIYAZAKI wore the yukata named "Float Flower" ("Yukata natsu kimono kikonashi BOOK 2006"/published by Index Communications Corporation-reference).

The same year, his creative range expanded to the design of yukata (Japanese summer kimono) for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd.'s yukata brand "METEYUNDE": his design attracted attention as the actress Aoi MIYAZAKI wore the yukata called "Float Flower" ("Yukata natsu kimono kikonashi BOOK 2006," published by Index Communications Corporation (reference)).

Also in 2006, Yoshida expanded his creative horizons to include the designing of yukata (Japanese summer kimono) for Kawashima Selkon Textiles Co., Ltd's 'METEYUNDE' brand; his designs attracted considerable attention after actress Aoi MIYAZAKI appeared wearing the "Float Flower" yukata, which Yoshida had designed (reference: 'Yukata natsu kimono kikonashi BOOK 2006,' published by Index Communications Corporation).

sen.j: 日常の何気ない風景を日本画の体表的な材料である墨と胡粉のみを用いて表現しており、その独自の視点と色彩感覚で描かれた光と影の世界は浮遊感があり映像的です。
sen.e: He expresses daily casual scenes using only black ink and chalk, the typical material used for the Japanese painting, and creates the world of light and shadow with his unique perspectives and sense of color, bringing a feeling of floating and image.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His work expresses daily casual scenes using only black ink and chalk (the typical materials used for Japanese painting) and he creates a world of light and shadow with his unique perspectives and sense of tonality, by which he creates a sense of floating images.

Using only black ink and chalk--the typical materials in Japanese-style painting--he expresses the essence of relaxed, everyday life, and conjures up a world of light and shadow through his unique perspectives and sense of tonality, with which he creates an airy, floating impression in his images.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。two most surface-related→typical（体表的は代表的の誤りであると判断しました）

sen.j: 日本画の伝統的な素材や技法を継承しつつ、新たな絵画表現を追求しています。
sen.e: While taking over the traditional material and technique of the Japanese painting, he seeks a new way of expression in painting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Though he assumes the traditional material and technique of Japanese painting, he seeks a new means of expression through his work.
Although he has accepted the legacy of Japanese-style painting by using its traditional materials and techiques, he seeks a fresh new mode of expression through his work.
